overview.summary: Master data forms the foundation of Project Beacon's litigation management system. These reference entities define the WHO (Employees, Contacts, Judges), WHERE (Legal Authorities), and WHEN (Statutory Deadlines) of case management.
overview.systemImpact: Incorrect or incomplete master data propagates errors across cases, hearings, tasks, and reports. A single wrong court assignment can cause missed deadlines and compliance failures.
overview.governanceNote: Master data changes are audited. Deletions are soft by design to preserve referential integrity with historical records.

dependencyMap.description: Master data flows downstream to operational entities. Understanding these dependencies prevents data corruption.
dependencyMap.visualFlow: Legal Authorities → Cases → Hearings ← Judges | Employees → Tasks | Contacts → Clients → Portal

dependencies.impactDescription: Defines jurisdiction, court hierarchy, and applicable deadline rules
dependencies.riskIfIncorrect: Wrong statutory deadlines applied, cases routed to invalid courts

dependencies.impactDescription: Determines who presides over hearings and delivers orders
dependencies.riskIfIncorrect: Hearings assigned to unavailable judges, incorrect bench information

dependencies.impactDescription: Controls case ownership, task routing, data visibility, and permissions
dependencies.riskIfIncorrect: Cases orphaned, notifications fail, security breaches via wrong permissions

dependencies.impactDescription: Enables client relationships, case party identification, and portal access
dependencies.riskIfIncorrect: Wrong person receives confidential information, portal access to unauthorized users

dependencies.impactDescription: Calculates legal time limits, creates compliance tasks, triggers deadline alerts
dependencies.riskIfIncorrect: Miscalculated deadlines, missed filings, potential case dismissal

dataQualityPrinciples.description: Each entity should exist only once. No duplicate courts, judges, or contacts.
dataQualityPrinciples.implementation: Use deduplication checks before import, search before create

dataQualityPrinciples.description: Fill all required fields before linking master data to cases or other entities.
dataQualityPrinciples.implementation: Form validation prevents incomplete entries from being linked

dataQualityPrinciples.description: Verify data against authoritative sources (Bar Council, GST Portal, Court directories).
dataQualityPrinciples.implementation: Cross-reference official sources, use GSP API for GST data

dataQualityPrinciples.description: Review master data quarterly for stale, orphaned, or incorrect records.
dataQualityPrinciples.implementation: Use 'Last Updated' filter to find records not touched in 90+ days

dataQualityPrinciples.description: Never hard-delete master data. Mark as inactive to preserve case history.
dataQualityPrinciples.implementation: Status field changes to 'Inactive' rather than DELETE operation

Admin.permissions: Full CRUD on all masters, import/export, bulk operations, audit review
Admin.responsibilities: Initial setup, onboarding/offboarding, quarterly audits, data cleanup
Admin.restrictions: Cannot bypass soft-delete for linked records

Partner.permissions: Create and edit masters for own practice areas and clients
Partner.responsibilities: Maintain accuracy of contacts and authorities in their cases
Partner.restrictions: Cannot delete, cannot modify system-critical fields (authority_level)

Manager.permissions: Create entries, limited edit (non-critical fields only)
Manager.responsibilities: Add new entries as directed, report data issues to Admin
Manager.restrictions: Cannot delete, cannot change permissions or hierarchy

Staff.responsibilities: Report inaccuracies to Manager or Admin
Staff.restrictions: No create, update, or delete access

Implementor.responsibilities: Initial data import, hierarchy setup, validation
Implementor.restrictions: Access revoked or reduced post go-live

daily: Check for duplicate alerts from import jobs
weekly: Verify contact information for active clients
monthly: Run deduplication check across all masters
quarterly: Full master data audit with compliance report
Review role assignments and data scope settings
Update statutory deadline rules for new legislation
Refresh holiday calendar if near year-end
annually: Archive inactive records older than retention period
Review and update authority hierarchy for new courts

commonErrors.cause: Same court imported from multiple sources
commonErrors.symptom: Cases split across duplicates, reports show inflated counts
commonErrors.fix: Merge duplicates using Admin merge tool, update case references

commonErrors.cause: A reports to B, B reports to A
commonErrors.symptom: Infinite loop in Team Cases visibility calculation
commonErrors.fix: Break cycle by reassigning one manager, use hierarchy visualization

commonErrors.cause: Client deleted but contact not archived
commonErrors.symptom: Contact appears in lists but can't be linked to cases
commonErrors.fix: Archive orphaned contacts or reassign to new client

commonErrors.symptom: Reply due dates incorrect by weeks/months
commonErrors.fix: Verify base_date_type in statutory event type configuration

commonErrors.symptom: Judge appears in wrong court's dropdown, hearing data incorrect
commonErrors.fix: Update judge's court assignment, verify hearing records
